channel.title: My Small Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content on My Small Hugo Site

item.title: xargs
item.description: copy all the .png file ( find in . recursively) to testdir: find . -name "*.png" | xargs -n1 -i cp {} testdir

item.title: Image_convertion
item.description: install : https://www.imagemagick.org/script/index.php 1) covert format: convert -units PixelsPerInch -density 600 SimPlot.wmf image.png 2) white background to transparent (be cautious) convert -density 600 -transparent white SimPlot.wmf trans_bg.png 3)transparent background to white convert -background white -alpha remove trans_bg.png white_bg.png install : inkscape 1) pdf to svg inkscape -l out.svg in.pdf

item.title: Web_tools_1
item.description: convert pdf to svg inkscape -l out.svg 95strains.pdf color code: HEX to RGB https://www.webpagefx.com/web-design/hex-to-rgb/ citaiton BibTex to APA http://ref.lexique.org/ hot to get BibTex of a paper > gogle scholar > setting –> Bibliography manager –> show links to import citation into BibTex table generater in R https://haozhu233.github.io/kableExtra/awesome_table_in_html.html

item.title: Build_my_hugo_site
item.description: Record the steps of building a hugo site ( 2018-04) get the hugo binary and mv it in some where in PATH # https://github.com/gohugoio/hugo/releases wget https://github.com/gohugoio/hugo/releases/download/v0.39/hugo_0.39_Linux-64bit.tar.gz build a site hugo new Mysite take a look at the directory ▸ archetypes/ ▸ content/ ▸ layouts/ ▸ static/ config.toml make a post hugo new about.md # about.md is generated in content/about.md hugo new post/first.md # first.md is in content/post/first.

item.title: Simple_setting_git
item.description: Configuring Git in a new computer git config --global user.name "usrname" git config --global user.email "YOUR EMAIL ADDRESS" git config --global push.default simple remember to use the same email as in github, so that the github main page will record your activities.

item.title: New
item.description: try some code #include <stdio.h> int main(void) { printf("hello, aa!\n"); return 0; }
